intro: Korthalsella degeneri, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Korthalsella degeneri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
